description.narrative: In the Tristao Islands of Guinea, as a result of the twin processes of intensive deforestation and rapid population increase, rural women face depletion of the natural resources on which they almost exclusively depend. This programme seeks to empower rural Guinean women by improving their livelihoods and increasing their ability to contribute to their family's food security and the sustainable development of their communities, while simultaneously protecting the biological diversity of the islands. It combines capacity-building and income-generating activities, such as the use of free solar energy for lamps to process fish and raw plant materials and the planting of useful trees for reforestation and soil regeneration, and encourages the dissemination of these practices. As a result of the programme, rural women will be economically empowered and members of their families will be positively impacted and therefore better equipped to negotiate and challenge other structures of inequality and power imbalances in their lives
